There are two stacks here.  One NPE and one ClassNotFound.
The former is triggered by the refresh we perform on startup.
The latter is in the decorator thread.
Please let us know if you need help.

It turns out that the Team code was doing more than it needed so we have 
changed the code to be more efficient (i.e. not instantiate providers unless 
necessary). However, the root of this problem is a core bug during class 
loading.
From a VCM standpoint this is fixed. The core bug for this is bug 33862.

John A found another scenario where this occurs. If an editor is open on 
shutdown and this file is then modified in the file system, a refresh local is 
performed on startup. This will cause a build which is turn can load the CVS 
plugin (performing validateSave for resources changed by the build). If the CVS 
decorators are also on, then the NPE occurs because of the loading of the CVS 
plugin from two different threads.

The CVSProviderPlugin.getPlugin method has been modified to wait until the 
instance variable is none null. 

This change has been inspected by John A.

I just witnessed that the CVS UI plugin can fail in the same way. We should 
apply the same fix to the CVS UI plugin, perferably for 2.1
